name: keep-a-changelog
description: An extension that provides snippets for markdown files to create a changelog with the ruleset of Keep a Changelog.

scripts.pretest: yarn run compile && yarn run lint

keep-a-changelog.validFiles.title: Valid Files
keep-a-changelog.validFiles.description:
The list of file names in which changelog snippets should be shown.
This is useful so snippets are not suggested in all Markdown files.
File names don't need the file extension and are case insensitive.

keep-a-changelog.untitledFile.title: Untitled File
keep-a-changelog.untitledFile.description: When true, snippets will also work in untitled markdown files.

keep-a-changelog.triggerCharacter.title: Trigger Character
keep-a-changelog.triggerCharacter.description: When true, changelog snippet suggestions will be triggered by the character '-'.

keep-a-changelog.dateFormat.title: Date Format
keep-a-changelog.dateFormat.description: The format of the date in the changelog.

keep-a-changelog.dateSeparator.title: Date Separator
keep-a-changelog.dateSeparator.description: The separator used for the date format in the changelog.

keep-a-changelog.defaultAuthor.title: Default Author
keep-a-changelog.defaultAuthor.description:
The default author used for URLs within the changelog.
If empty, it will use tab-completion within the snippet.
Can be overriden via workspace settings.

keep-a-changelog.defaultRepository.title: Default Repository
keep-a-changelog.defaultRepository.description:
The default repository used for URLs within the changelog.
If empty, it will use tab-completion within the snippet.
Can be overriden via workspace settings.

keep-a-changelog.versionPrefix.title: Version Tag Prefix
keep-a-changelog.versionPrefix.description: The prefix to use for version tags in the changelog.
